item.title: 亚洲股市下滑，日元在日本央行决议前摇摆不定
item.description: 周五，亚洲股市下跌，原因是投资者在美联储缓和其降息观点后对美国利率前景进行了思考，即使通胀率低于预期。【原文：Asian stocks fell on Friday as investors pondered the outlook for U.S. rates after the Federal Reserve tempered its rate-cut views even as inflation came in softer than expected, while the yen was shaky before the Bank of Japan's policy meeting.】

item.title: 日元在日本央行会议前保持警惕；欧元跌跌不休，周线失守在望
item.description: 周五，在日本央行做出可能进一步削减大规模货币刺激政策的政策决定之前，日元处于守势，而在其他地区，欧元因深陷政治动荡而每周下跌。【原文：The yen was on the defensive on Friday ahead of a policy decision from the Bank of Japan that could see it further reduce its massive monetary stimulus, while elsewhere the euro, mired in political turmoil, was headed for a weekly loss.】

item.title: 需求前景稳健，油价有望每周上涨
item.description: 油价周五下跌，但有望实现四周来的首次周涨幅，因为市场评估了美国利率长期化的影响，以及今年原油和燃料需求的稳健前景。【原文：Oil prices fell on Friday but were on track for their first weekly gain in four weeks as markets assessed the impact of higher-for-longer U.S. interest rates versus solid outlooks for crude and fuel demand this year.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行将在 9 月前维持利率不变，并在第四季度首次降息：路透调查
item.description: 路透社对所有经济学家进行的调查显示，澳大利亚储备银行将在周二的会议上连续第五次维持其关键政策利率不变，原因是价格压力持续存在。【原文：The Reserve Bank of Australia will hold its key policy rate for a fifth straight meeting on Tuesday over persistent price pressures, according to all economists polled by Reuters, a majority of whom expected the first cut to come in the last quarter of the year.】

item.title: 威士卡和万事达卡 300 亿美元费用和解协议岌岌可危
item.description: 威士（Visa）和万事达（Mastercard）拟达成 300 亿美元的反垄断和解协议，以限制商家的信用卡和借记卡费用，但纽约一名法官表示她准备否决该协议，这使该协议岌岌可危。【原文：Visa's and Mastercard's proposed $30 billion antitrust settlement to limit credit and debit card fees for merchants is in peril, after a New York judge signaled she was preparing to reject the accord.】

item.title: 因技术故障，GameStop 将股东大会推迟至 6 月 17 日举行
item.description: 视频游戏零售商 GameStop 表示，由于技术故障，周四举行的虚拟年度股东大会被推迟，没有开展任何业务。【原文：Video game retailer GameStop said that its virtual annual shareholders' meeting on Thursday was postponed without any business being conducted due to technical difficulties.】

item.title: 乐购董事会因首席执行官 1,000 万英镑的薪酬待遇而备受争议
item.description: 英国最大的超市集团乐购（Tesco）将于本周五召开股东年会，届时董事会将被要求说明首席执行官肯-墨菲（Ken Murphy）近 1,000 万英镑（1,300 万美元）薪酬的合理性。【原文：The board of Tesco , Britain's biggest supermarket group, will be asked to justify chief executive Ken Murphy's near 10 million pounds ($13 million) pay package when it faces shareholders at its annual meeting on Friday.】

item.title: 加拿大人承认窃取特斯拉商业机密罪
item.description: 据美国司法部（DOJ）称，一名加拿大籍中国居民周四在纽约联邦法院承认窃取特斯拉电动汽车电池制造商业机密，并密谋将其出售给政府卧底特工。【原文：A Canadian resident of China pleaded guilty in New York federal court on Thursday to stealing Tesla electric-vehicle battery manufacturing trade secrets and conspiring to sell them to undercover government agents, according to the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ).】

item.title: 美国政府将为口服和鼻腔接种 COVID 疫苗的研究提供高达 5 亿美元的资助
item.description: 美国卫生与公众服务部（HHS）周四表示，它将为中期试验提供高达 5 亿美元的资金，用于评估以鼻腔喷雾或药片形式接种疫苗以预防有症状的 COVID-19 的情况。【原文：The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) said on Thursday it will provide up to $500 million for mid-stage trials evaluating vaccines administered as a nasal spray or pill to protect against symptomatic COVID-19.】

item.title: 加拿大议会在罕见会议上就气候政策质询银行首席执行官
item.description: 加拿大五大银行的首席执行官周四向国会议员保证，他们将致力于应对气候变化，但同时表示，减少对化石燃料开采的资助需要时间，而且要实现净零排放还需要做更多的工作。【原文：The CEOs of Canada's big five banks on Thursday reassured members of parliament about their commitment to fighting climate change, but said reducing funding for fossil fuel extraction would take time and more works need to be done to reach net zero emissions.】

item.title: 纽约银行收购了总公允价值为 378 亿美元的 Signature Bank 资产
item.description: 纽约社区银行公司（New York Community Bancorp）周四表示，它收购了倒闭的 Signature 银行的资产，估计总公允价值为 378 亿美元。【原文：New York Community Bancorp said on Thursday it acquired the assets of the failed Signature Bank with an estimated total fair value of $37.8 billion.】

item.title: 五角大楼火箭发射合同花落蓝色起源、SpaceX 和联合发射联盟
item.description: 美国国防部周四选择了蓝色起源公司（Blue Origin）、SpaceX公司和波音-洛克希德合资的联合发射联盟公司（ULA）参与国家安全太空任务的竞争，根据一项价值56亿美元的奖励计划进行初步筛选。【原文：The U.S. Department of Defense on Thursday picked Blue Origin, SpaceX and the Boeing-Lockheed joint venture United Launch Alliance (ULA) to compete for national security space missions, making initial selections under an award program valued at $5.6 billion.】

item.title: 自 2018 年首次批准马斯克的薪酬方案以来特斯拉的表现
item.description: 在特拉华州法院今年早些时候宣布特斯拉薪酬协议无效后，特斯拉股东在关键的年度股东大会上第二次批准了首席执行官埃隆-马斯克 560 亿美元的薪酬方案。【原文：Tesla shareholders have approved CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion remuneration package for the second time at a crucial annual shareholder meeting after a Delaware court invalidated the pay deal earlier this year.】

item.title: 早间竞价：美联储谨慎，日本央行呢？
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: Teva 就米非司酮 "垄断 "罕见疾病起诉 Corcept
item.description: Teva Pharmaceuticals 公司周四在旧金山联邦法院起诉竞争对手 Corcept Therapeutics 公司，指控该公司垄断了米非司酮类药物 Korlym 的市场，而 Korlym 用于治疗一种名为库欣综合征的罕见激素紊乱。【原文：Teva Pharmaceuticals sued rival drugmaker Corcept Therapeutics in federal court in San Francisco on Thursday, accusing it of monopolizing the market for mifepristone-based Korlym, used to treat a rare hormonal disorder called Cushing's syndrome.】

item.title: 日本央行将维持超低利率，可能发出缩减债券规模的信号
item.description: 日本央行周五可能会维持超低利率，但会考虑是否开始缩减其庞大的资产负债表，缓慢但稳步地退出大规模货币刺激政策。【原文：The Bank of Japan is likely to keep interest rates ultra-low on Friday but consider whether to start reducing its huge balance sheet in a slow but steady retreat from its massive monetary stimulus.】

item.title: Reddit 上的帖子显示，Roaring Kitty 持有的 GameStop 股份几乎翻了一番，达到 900 万股
item.description: 有 "咆哮小猫 "之称的股票影响者基思-吉尔（Keith Gill）周四更新了他对 GameStop 的持股情况，显示他现在持有该公司 900 万股股票，高于本周初的 500 万股。【原文：Keith Gill, the stock influencer known as Roaring Kitty, updated his holding of GameStop on Thursday to show he now owns 9 million shares of the company, up from 5 million at the start of the week.】

item.title: 福特撤销对电动汽车经销商的限制以促进销售
item.description: 福特汽车公司（Ford Motor Co）将很快允许其所有经销商销售电动汽车，从而扭转其更具选择性的分配制度，以努力促进低于预期的销售。【原文：Ford Motor Co will soon allow all of its dealers to sell electric vehicles, reversing its more selective allocation system in an effort to boost slower-than-expected sales.】

item.title: 加纳债券持有人将于下周就债务重组问题再次与政府接触
item.description: 四位消息人士告诉路透社，继本周早些时候与官方债权人敲定协议之后，加纳及其债券持有人将于下周重启谈判，就 130 亿美元的国际债券达成债务重组协议。【原文：Ghana and its bondholders will restart talks next week to hash out a debt restructuring deal on $13 billion of international bonds, four sources told Reuters, on the heels of a deal finalised with official creditors earlier this week.】

item.title: 巴西 TIM 可能从意大利电信网络出售中受益
item.description: TIM Brasil 首席执行官阿尔贝托-格里塞利（Alberto Griselli）周四表示，其母公司意大利电信公司同意出售其物理网络，这将进一步推动其在巴西的业务。【原文：The chief executive of TIM Brasil , Alberto Griselli, said on Thursday that its parent company Telecom Italia's agreement to sell its physical network could provide an additional boost for its business in Brazil.】

item.title: Adobe 季度收入超出预期
item.description: Photoshop 制造商 Adobe 周四公布的第二季度营收超出华尔街预期，原因是在经济出现缓和迹象的情况下，越来越多的企业和消费者开始使用其人工智能驱动的编辑工具。【原文：Photoshop maker Adobe beat Wall Street expectations for second-quarter revenue on Thursday as more businesses and consumers take to its artificial intelligence-powered editing tools amid signs of an easing economy.】

item.title: 美国因阿联酋航空在禁飞空域运营罚款 150 万美元
item.description: 美国运输部周四表示，对阿联酋航空罚款 150 万美元，原因是该公司在禁止飞行的空域运营携带捷蓝航空公司代号的航班。【原文：The U.S. Transportation Department said on Thursday it fined Emirates $1.5 million for operating flights carrying JetBlue Airways’ designator code in prohibited airspace.】

item.title: 调查发现，雇主对减肥药的承保大幅增加
item.description: 据国际雇员福利计划基金会周四发布的一项全球雇主调查显示，约有三分之一的美国雇主医疗保险计划提供用于糖尿病管理和减肥的 GLP-1 药物，比去年有所增加。【原文：About one-third of U.S. employer health plans are offering coverage of GLP-1 drugs for both diabetes management and weight loss, up from last year, according to a survey of global employers released on Thursday by the International Foundation of Employee Benefit Plans.】

item.title: 阿根廷 5 月通胀率放缓至 4.2% m/m
item.description: 周四公布的官方数据显示，阿根廷 5 月份的月通胀率为 4.2%，低于路透社民调预测的 4.9%，也低于 4 月份的 8.8%。【原文：Argentina's monthly inflation rate stood at 4.2% in May, official data published on Thursday shows, landing below a Reuters poll forecast of 4.9% and slowing down from April's rate of 8.8%.】

item.title: 加元走软，美元广泛上涨
item.description: 周四，加元兑美元走软，因为美元兑一篮子主要货币上涨，而且加拿大央行重申可能进一步降息。【原文：The Canadian dollar weakened against its U.S. counterpart on Thursday as the greenback notched gains against a basket of major currencies and the Bank of Canada reiterated it could cut interest rates further.】

item.title: 耶伦称中国大型银行对违反美国对俄制裁持谨慎态度
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周四表示，她相信中国最大的银行注意到了美国对俄罗斯的制裁，并不想违反这些制裁，但她补充说，如果美国认为有必要，将不排除采取行动。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said Thursday that she believes the largest Chinese banks are mindful of U.S. sanctions against Russia and do not want to violate them, but added the U.S. will not rule out taking action if it deems it necessary.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克的投资者粉丝团欢呼特斯拉 560 亿美元薪酬方案明显获批
item.description: 特斯拉公司首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）表示，尽管遭到了大型机构的反对，但股东们仍以较大优势投票通过了其 560 亿美元的薪酬方案。【原文：Elon Musk's army of small-investor allies took a victory lap with an endorsement for his $56 billion pay package after the Tesla CEO said shareholders were voting to approve it by a wide margin despite opposition from major institutions.】

item.title: 摩根大通与希腊金融科技公司在伦敦法庭胜诉
item.description: 华尔街银行摩根大通（JP Morgan）和希腊金融科技公司老板哈里斯-卡罗尼斯（Haris Karonis）周四在伦敦法庭上就如何对一家联合企业进行估值的争论中均宣称取得了成功，为其可能的出售铺平了道路。【原文：Wall Street bank JP Morgan and Greek fintech boss Haris Karonis both claimed success on Thursday in a London court battle over how to value a joint business, paving the way for its potential sale.】

item.title: 英国 Bellway 公司确认出价 83 亿美元收购竞争对手 Crest Nicholson
item.description: 英国住宅建筑商贝尔威公司（Bellway）周四证实，该公司最近提出了全股收购 Crest Nicholson 的要约，该交易对竞争对手的估值约为 65 亿英镑（82.9 亿美元）。【原文：British homebuilder Bellway on Thursday confirmed that it had recently made an all-share offer to acquire Crest Nicholson , in a deal which would have valued the rival at about 6.5 billion pounds ($8.29 billion).】

item.title: 苹果公司在诉讼中被控向加州女工支付过低薪酬
item.description: 原告律师称，苹果公司周四遭到集体诉讼，指控这家科技巨头支付给加利福尼亚州 12,000 多名女性员工的薪水低于从事类似工作的男性。【原文：Apple on Thursday was hit with a proposed class action accusing the tech giant of paying more than 12,000 female employees in California less than men with comparable jobs, lawyers for the plaintiffs said.】
